title: Words
quoted_scripture: From the same mouth come blessing and cursing.
body_text:
I struggled to learn how to read no matter how hard I tried as a child.Until I met my grade 8 teacher, Mrs. G.
Just before a spelling test Mrs. G pulled me aside. "I wondered if you would be more comfortable spelling your words out loud while you helped me decorate this bulletin board."
A few minutes later Mrs. G. said, "You've answered them all correctly even the ones you weren't supposed to know!" Always a poor student, I was amazed. Had I really done well?
Mrs. G's compassion and sensitivity encouraged me and showed me I could succeed. Her words showed me that she believed in me when I couldn't believe in myself. No wonder the Bible reminds us that our words have the power to destroy and the power to build up. (Proverbs 12:6)
With God's help I'd like to live out Psalm 19: 14: "Let the words of my mouth and the meditation of my heart be acceptable in your sight, 0 Lord, my rock and my redeemer." (ESV)
thought_for_the_day: Anxiety in a man's heart weighs him down, but a good word makes him glad. - Proverbs 12:25 (ESV)
prayer: Help me Lord to treat others with kindness.
prayer_focus: Who is need of encouragement? How can I help them today?
